reviewText: What can I say...I love Matlock.
Difficult to pick out Matlock's greatest cases, but this is a pretty good group.
I really really joy watching Matlock

Since I'm NOT made of money... I bought the twelve-episode sample/tester compilation before making a final decision on---possibly--- buying either * Matlock: The Complete Series, for..($130), or, * Matlock: The Complete Series Pack($153). //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// The, 3-DVD, [9.5-hour]{4:3/Dolby English/English SDH} episodes are: 1.) 09/23/'86 THE JUDGE.............................................................. w/ Dick Van Dyke, born 1925. 2.) 11/11/'86 THE SISTERS........................................................... with Gail O'Grady, born 1963, and the classic TV's Perry Mason cast member, James McEachin, born 1930. 3.) 10/27/'87 THE POWER BROKERS: part 1 w/ Ralph Bellamy [1904-1991], Robert Culp[1930-2010], Scott Bakula, 1954. 4.) 11/03/'87 THE POWER BROKERS: part 2 w/ Ralph Bellamy [1904-1991], Robert Culp[1930-2010], Scott Bakula, 1954. 5.) 11/29/'88 THE LEMON................................................................ with Don Knotts [1924-2006]. 6.) 01/16/'90 THE TALK SHOW..................................................... w/ Samantha Eggar, born 1939. 7.) 11/13/'90 THE BROTHERS ......................................................... with Don Knotts [1924-2006]. 8.) 11/08/'91 THE MARRIAGE COUNSELLOR............. with Aneta "Helen Crump" Corsaut [1933-1995], Bryan Cranston, born 1956. 9.) 02/28/'92 THE BIG PAYOFF........................................................ with Randy Travis, born 1959. 10) 03/18/'93 THE DEBT................................................................ with Amy Yasbeck, born 1962. 11) 11/04/'93 THE LAST LAUGH....................................................... with Milton Berle [1908-2002]. 12) 10/27/'94 THE DARE................................................................... with Terry O'Quinn ("Lost"). I am a Navy/Army retiree, and moved around a lot, I haven't seen most of this series. Since I retired to Europe, these episodes will, literally, be a breath-of-home that I missed during my "tour-of-duty". VERY enjoyable series cram-packed with familiar faces, many of which, no longer with us. Sincerely Yours, Michael McCluskey ----[1949-20??]----
I've seen many of these shows on tv but I still enjoy them.  Matlock has a way of drawing you into the story.
Thank you so much for the movie I really enjoyed it
Great viewing with Matlock at the top of his game.

As a casual fan of Matlock and a fan of Andy Griffith, I was interested in purchasing this set. The price was right and twelve episodes seemed a reasonable purchase. The set was excellent almost every episode could be considered a "Greatest" episode. Whoever selected the episodes did a fantastic job. Only "The Matchmaker" in my opinion was weak, with a bit too much of a comedy aspect to the episode. Having said that the rest of the shows selected were outstanding murder mysteries and courtroom drama. I hope they do a few more "Greatest Cases".
Yes..Definetely the greatest cases..Great viewing for the casual fan.
I love the DVD's they came on time.
I love this DVD, it has the best shows and plays very well.
Matlock is one of those shows I never get tired of watching I've seen all of the episodes but never get sick of seeing them over and over again
